title: Lok Sabha elections: Raj Thackeray‚Äôs MNS backs BJP-led alliance in Maharashtra

Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray on Tuesday announced that his party will extend ‚Äúunconditional support‚Äù to the state‚Äôs ruling Mahayuti alliance in the Lok Sabha elections.The Mahayuti alliance comprises the Bharatiya Janata Party, the Chief Minister Eknath Shinde-led faction of the Shiv Sena and Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar‚Äôs Nationalist Congress Party group.‚ÄúThe country today needs strong leadership,‚Äù Thackeray said at a rally in Mumbai, The Indian Express reported.He added that his support to the BJP-led alliance was ‚Äúonly to make Narendra Modi the prime minister for another term‚Äù. ‚ÄúIndia is a country of youngsters, who need opportunities,‚Äù Thackeray said. ‚ÄúI expect Narendra Modi to concentrate on youngsters. They [youth] are the future. This election will decide the future of this country.‚ÄùThackeray, who broke away from the then undivided Shiv Sena in 2006 to create the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena that year, added that Shinde and Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis had been asking him to ‚Äúcome together‚Äù for the past year and a half.‚ÄúI wanted to know what exactly they mean‚Ä¶ that is why I called [Union Home Minister] Amit Shah and went to meet him,‚Äù Thackeray said, referring to his meeting with Shah in March.‡§ó‡•Å‡§¢‡•Ä‡§™‡§æ‡§°‡§µ‡§æ ‡§Æ‡•á‡§≥‡§æ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∑‡§£‡§æ‡§§‡•Ä‡§≤ ‡§Æ‡§π‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡•á ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡•á :üî∏‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡§°‡§£‡•Ç‡§ï ‡§Ü‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§æ‡§®‡•á ‡§Ü‡§§‡§æ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§®‡§æ‡§π‡•Ä ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡§°‡§£‡•Å‡§ï‡•Ä‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§ ‡§ú‡•Å‡§Ç‡§™‡§≤‡§Ç ‡§Ü‡§π‡•á, ‡§π‡•á ‡§ö‡•Å‡§ï‡•Ä‡§ö‡§Ç ‡§Ü‡§π‡•á. ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ã‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ç‡§®‡•Ä ‡§∞‡•Å‡§ó‡•ç‡§£‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•Ä ‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§æ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§§ ‡§∞‡§π‡§æ‡§µ‡•Ä, ‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§π‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡§°‡§£‡•Å‡§ï‡•Ä‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§ ‡§ï‡•ã‡§£ ‡§ú‡•Å‡§Ç‡§™‡§§‡§Ç ‡§π‡•á‡§ö ‡§Æ‡•Ä ‡§™‡§æ‡§π‡§§‡•ã.üî∏‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§ ‡§∂‡§π‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§≠‡•á‡§ü‡•Ä‡§®‡§Ç‡§§‡§∞ ‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/oke8Z4km9T‚Äî Raj Thackeray (@RajThackeray) April 9, 2024


‚ÄúThe only symbol I will fight [any election] on is that of the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena,‚Äù Thackeray added.He said that his opposition to Modi in the 2019 general election was not personal. ‚ÄúUnlike [Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) party leaders] Uddhav Thackeray and Sanjay Raut, I did not want to become the chief minister,‚Äù Thackeray said. ‚ÄúI opposed him [Modi] on issues. You [Uddhav Thackeray and Raut] are doing it now because your party is split, for your selfish gains.‚ÄùShinde and his supporters had rebelled against Uddhav Thackeray in June 2022, which led to a split in the Shiv Sena and collapse of the Maha Vikas Aghadi government in the state. Shinde was subsequently made the chief minister after he joined hands with the BJP.The Maharashtra Navnirman Sena had not contested the 2019 Lok Sabha polls. In the Assembly elections that year, the party had won one seat out of the 101 seats it contested. The Maharashtra Assembly has 288 members. The party‚Äôs vote share was 2.3%.Grateful for support, says Devendra FadnavisOn Monday, Fadnavis said that he was grateful to the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena president for extending his support to the Mahayuti alliance.The deputy chief minister said in a social media post that he welcomed Thackeray‚Äôs decision ‚Äúto believe in the able leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi ji, to realise the dream of a developed country and for building a strong Maharashtra‚Äù.‡§∏‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡•á‡§π ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§ó‡§§ ! ‡§Æ‡§æ. ‡§™‡§Ç‡§§‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ß‡§æ‡§® ‡§®‡§∞‡•á‡§Ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡•ã‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ú‡•Ä ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∂‡§≤ ‡§®‡•á‡§§‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§µ‡§∞ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§†‡•á‡§µ‡§§,‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡§∏‡§ø‡§§ ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§§‡§æ‡§ö‡•á ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡•ç‡§® ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞ ‡§ï‡§∞‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∏‡§æ‡§†‡•Ä,‡§≠‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§Æ ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§â‡§≠‡§æ‡§∞‡§£‡•Ä‡§∏‡§æ‡§†‡•Ä,‡§≠‡§æ‡§ú‡§™‡§æ, ‡§∂‡§ø‡§µ‡§∏‡•á‡§®‡§æ ‡§Ü‡§£‡§ø ‡§∞‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä ‡§ï‡§æ‡§Å‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∏ ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§§‡•Ä‡§≤‡§æ ‡§™‡§æ‡§†‡§ø‡§Ç‡§¨‡§æ ‡§¶‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¨‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§≤ ‡§Æ‡•Ä ‡§Æ‡§®‡§∏‡•á‡§ö‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú ‡§†‡§æ‡§ï‡§∞‡•á ‡§ú‡•Ä ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç‡§ö‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç‡§§‚Ä¶‚Äî Devendra Fadnavis (Modi Ka Parivar) (@Dev_Fadnavis) April 9, 2024
